root.name: setFloat()

example.code:
JSONObject json def setup(): json = JSONObject()
json.setInt("count", 88) json.setFloat("weight", 35.432) json.setString("name", "celery") json.setBoolean("isFruit", False) count = json.getInt("count") weight = json.getFloat("weight") name = json.getString("name") boolean isFruit = json.getBoolean("isFruit") println(count + ", " + weight + ", " + name + ", " + isFruit) # Sketch prints: # 88, 35.432, celery, False

root.description: Inserts a new key/float pair into the JSONObject or, if a value with the specified key already exists, assigns a new value.
